result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrese Rapheal Lipford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tyrese Rapheal Lipford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tyrese Rapheal Lipford was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**COMMENCE FORTHWITH**
To run concurrent to Milwaukee Co cases 18CF3120 & 19CF5047.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores. Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

of DNA Collection at Conviction

9:30 AM 
Defendant Tyrese Rapheal Lipford in court, in custody @ Milw. Secured Det. Facility.
Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Tyrese Rapheal Lipford.
Attorney Rosa Delgado in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance. 
Defendant admits to prior convictions and entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel. Possess Amphetamine/LSD-2nd, Repeater;
Found guilty by the court; Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion.  Second paragraph of the information was stricken.
Parties waived the PSI report and proceeded to sentencing:
Ct 1:
 Initial Term of Confinement:  12 months, forthwith.
Extended Supervision:  12 months.
Total Length of Sentence:  24 months. 
166 days sentence credit given.
Conditions of extended supervision given.
To run concurrent to Milwaukee cases 18CF3120 & 19CF5047.
Court costs ordered; no restitution ordered.
Defendant is eligible for the CIP and SAP programs.
Submit to DNA sample and pay surcharge, unless previously provided.
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. 
Appeal rights given.
